results.title: Blue like an orange
results.brief_description: Puppets of the Orient and the Occident are presented in this UNESCO contribution to understanding between East and West. Scenes of puppet plays in India, Japan, Singapore, Malaysia, Laos, Poland, Czechoslovakia and the United States today. The presentations illustrate the great variety of the traditions which have survived for thousands of years. Also includes archival footage of Jim Henson and “the muppets” including a very early Kermit.

results.title: Blue in the face
results.creator_credit: Paul Auster, Wayne Wang, Diana Phillips, Peter Newman, Greg Johnson and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Director Wayne Wang and screenwriter Paul Auster team up again for the follow up movie from “Smoke”. This film once again centres on the Brooklyn corner Cigar Store and manager Auggie Wren (Harvey Keitel), although most of the other characters are different. Plotlines follow Auggie’s frustrated wife, Dot (Roseanne), and her attempts to seduce her husband. Also included are appearances by Jim Jarmusch, who shows up as a man about to smoke his last cigarette, and Lily Tomlin as a man with chest hair, obsessed with acquiring a Belgian waffle. Cast also includes Madonna, Michael J. Fox, Lou Reed (as himself) and Mira Sorvino.

results.title: Blue Ice
results.creator_credit: Phillip Garth Law, Film Australia and External Affairs
results.brief_description: A record of the 1954 Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition, which relieved the scientific stations at Macquarie and Heard Islands and established a new station at Mawson on MacRobertson Land in Australian Antarctic Territory. The film describes the expedition’s departure from Melbourne in December 1953 and follows its 12,000 mile journey through high seas and pack ice, providing an insight into daily life at the stations and the challenges presented by often-difficult conditions. There is stunning footage of towering icebergs and masses of penguins as well as aerial reconnaissance and surveillance.

results.title: Blue Heelers
results.brief_description: Blue Heelers is an Australian police drama series which depicted the lives of police officers stationed at the fictional Mount Thomas police station in a small town in Victoria.

constellations_other.name: Australian TV in the 1990s
constellations_other.description: In the 1990s, Australians and Australian culture was changing: so too were the representations of it on television.

results.title: Blue Hawaii (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, Hal Wallis and Hal Wallis Productions
results.brief_description: Chad Gates (Elvis Presley) returns to Hawaii after leaving the army. On his return he rebels against his rich and domineering mother (Angela Lansbury) and leaves the family pineapple business for a job as a tourist guide. Chad’s tours lead him straight into a tropical squall of trouble with his mother, the law and his girlfriend. Stars: Elvis Presley, Joan Blackman and Angela Lansbury.

results.title: Blue fin (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Carl Schultz, Hal McElroy and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Pascoe expects too much from his son Snook, who always seems to be in trouble. Disaster strikes Blue Fin at sea and young Snook is the only one who can save them. The boat is wrecked and sinking. Pascoe lies injured and the crew swept overboard. Blue Fin is a heart warming story of youth growing to maturity and of human relationships.

results.title: Blue fin
results.creator_credit: Carl Schultz, Hal McElroy and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Colin Thiele, this is a heartwarming story of a boy growing to maturity. Pascoe expects too much of his young son Snook, who always seems to be in trouble. Disaster strikes their boat Blue Fin at sea and young Snook is the only person left who can save them. The boat is wrecked and sinking. Pascoe lies injured, his crew swept overboard. The waves are mountainous … can Snook save his father and the Blue Fin? Rated: G.

results.title: Blue eyed
results.brief_description: Blue eyed is a confronting documentary which follows Jane Elliott at work as she conducts a workshop about prejudice and racism. She does this by dividing her audience into two groups; blue eyed and brown eyed as uses the colour distinction to demonstrate the powerful impact of discrimination and the effect is has on the victim’s emotions. Designed for use by schools and businesses to illustrate the anatomy of prejudice and the effects of racism.
